title: Some emails from Microsoft Exchange are not received with POP3
content:
Some incoming emails do not appear in my Thunderbird Inbox. The mail environment is as follows.

Server: Microsoft Exchange Mailer: Thunderbird Receiving protocol: POP3

They are not in the spam folder. This problem is occurring with some emails from a specific domain. Several people are experiencing the same problem.

Also, Outlook on the Web and IMAP can be used to view the messages.

Is there a possible reason why some emails are not showing up in POP3 and what can be done about it?
creator: karibe.haruka

title: Automate spam checking and unify it with inbox
content:
I have several email accounts in Thunderbird. As expected, it regularly checks the inbox in each of them and downloads the messages, this is fine. I would like it to do the same with ALL the folders, including the spam. How can this be done?

In the attached screenshots you can see my settings. For the sake of comfort, I have created a "saved search" that groups all the inboxes of each account, and I would like to find there all the spam folders as well (within the "inbox all" saved search), because still in 2023 the filters from the companies cannot be trusted, you end up missing a lot of important emails and even worse they cannot be deactivated, not even in premium corporate accounts. The thing is that each time I go to any of these saved searches they work fine, but for some reason they ignore the spam folders. If, within Thunderbird, I go to manually check each spam folder, then it downloads the messages and now they show up in the saved search. However, the process of Thunderbird connecting to the remote spam folder and downloading the messages is not automated when I go into the saved search. What am I missing?
creator: m.senger

title: Attachment not visible on some emails
content: Hello, sometimes I receive an email with attachment, but attachments are not visible within the client. The message source show there is an attachment (see attached image #1) If open the webmail I can see the attachment (see attached image #2). Up to now it happened only with pdf file (see attached image #3). I found a thread named "Thunderbird not showing attachments", that report the same issue, but the proposed solution is neither solving nor applicable to my PC. If needed, I can forward the email, there are no privacy issues. Thank you very much! Daniele

title: All day calender events move back one day
content:
Use Tbsync to synchronize (shaw) exchange calendar. Everything working great just have a weird problem.

When I create an all day event it gets stored in the correct day, then, after some time (like the next day) I observe the event has moved back one day?!

I suspect on way to resolve is to do a complete re-install of thunderbird. Seems like upgrading to tb115 is a good time? I assume a new profile will be called for BUT how to preserve messages etc.

Thanks for your help.
creator: peterawolfe1

title: Spam "Reply To" blacklist filter not working
content:
I've been getting a lot of spam the past few months, so have been working on filtering the true spam from new senders of email who are marked as Junk email.

To do this filtering, I've been using "From" blacklist filtering, and it seems to work well. But spammers are clever and this technique often doesn't work, so I'm now using "Reply To" filtering. It works sometimes but often doesn't work. Specifically, when I use a "Reply To" blacklist filter of ".3.", and then click to manually run the spam filtering, it usually doesn't work. It did once. I'm puzzled as to why it usually doesn't work.
creator: Don-Peters

title: For the error message "Unable to connect to your IMAP server..." it is unclear what server exectly.
content: Activity manager error message: "Unable to connect to your IMAP server. You may have exceeded the maximum number of connections to this server. If so, use the Advanced IMAP Server Settings dialog to reduce the number of cached connections." The message has no data about which (out of my 10 connected) server issues it. May be should add this info to the message?

title: cannnot sent email from thunderbird - one of many email addresses
content:
i use thunderbird with 8 email accounts all of them have been working flowlessly for many months by now all of a sudden, today evening, one of my accounts stopped sending emails and report ERROR: 

  Wysyłanie wiadomości się nie powiodło.   Wystąpił błąd podczas wysyłania wiadomości. Odpowiedź serwera poczty: Limit exceeded. Proszę    zweryfikować poprawność adresu e-mail w konfiguracji kont i spróbować ponownie.

in english i t says: 

  Sending a message failed.   An error occurred while sending the message. Mail server response: Limit exceeded. Please    verify the correctness of your email address in the account configuration and try again.

this account receives emails OK by just cannot sent anything

i have not changed any setup of any account space in my emapil server is used in 25% i use Kasperski antivirus, and the error persists even when i turn security off for some time

account data: SMTP server: contec.nazwa.pl port: 465 SSL/TLS normal password user: wojtek.szala@contec.nazwa.pl

what has happened to the system?
creator: wojtek.szala

title: I am trying to copy the file abook.sqlite to another PC
content:
I have located the file abook.sqlite on the original PC and I have copied to a USB key

But I cannot locate the correct location on the replacement PC. When using the new PC I have setup to use the 2nd drive to store the thunderbird data. Not using the primary drive , it is a small SSD Full address E:\xyz\Thunderbird\Profiles\xxx.default where xyz is primary folder setup by myself with a more description & xxx.default is the name setup by TBird when it was 1st setup today, I know that TBird is working as I received >300 emails when 1st running the new setup. I do not see a file abook.sqlite in this directory but see abook.mab dated 2020-03-12 I had also created as a test, a simple addressbook with only 3 entries.

Best Wishes Jim
creator: jim199

title: I want all my Thunderbird email folders (Inbox, Sent, locals, etc.) assigned to my D drive, not my C drive.
content: I have a very large D drive on my HP pc and a (relatively) small (128 gb) SSD C drive. I've had situations where there wasn't enough work space on the C drive for me to compact the folders until I tracked down the emails with large attachments and blew them away. I have every last bit of user data sitting on the D drive (docs, downloads, music, video, pics) ... except the TB email folders. And they're big enough to cause problems. Give me an option to select D as the default drive for TB email folders.

title: Copied ...\Roaming\Thunderbird to new Win 10 pc but SSL Problem stops Get Messages
content: I followed instructions for migrating thunderbird (102.14.0) pop client to new win 10 pc, (by copying ...\Roaming\Thunderbird) BUT, when I click on Get Messages literally nothing happens. Can't figure out how to get a log or error message. Here's a fact: When I comment out ...\Roaming\Thunderbird and start TB a new ...\Roaming\Thunderbird is created and messages are download BUT first I must "Add Security Exception" in pop up window. It says, "You are about to override how TB identifies this site" This is the pop server, pop.centurylink.net:995 and the SSL cert says it is from Lumen Technologies, (no doubt the mother company.) It easy with a new installation to "Confirm the Security Exception" but with the migrated data I get nothing. I attached the pop up window. any ideas?
